election_record.label: New York 1808 State Senate, Western District

candidate.name: Capt. Houder and I.T. Peter Solomon Vander Snekum

overview.note: Ebenezer Wakely, Samuel Campbell, Obadiah German, John M. Petrie, Westel Willoughby, Jr., Aaron Budlong, John Mills, Simeon Ford, Thomas Manly, David J. Andruss, Corlis Hinds, Ethel Brunson, Jesse Hopkins, Daniel Van Horne, John W. Bulkley, Oliver Brown, Erastus Cleveland, Samuel Marsh, William Whipple, David Ostrum, Benjamin Wright, James Dean, Joel Bristol, John Storrs, Thomas H. Hamilton, Jarvis Pike, Leavet Fox, Jacobus DePuy, Barent Muny, Asahel Minor, David Olmstead, Elnathan Andrus, Mead Mavrel, Samuel Lawrence, William Rogers, Micah Brooks, Hugh McNair, Richard Leach, Joseph Colt, Myron Holly, Daniel W. Lewis, Gideon Pitts, Amos Hall, Martin Luce, Henry Scott, Roger Kinne, Haviland Chace, Benjamin Gilbert, Abel DeForest, Ferdinand Vander Veer, and Volkert P. Van Rensselaer were candidates for Assembly. Peter B. Porter, Matthew Carpenter, Joseph Glover, Vincent Mathews, Uri Tracy, Ebenezer Foote, Joshua Hatheway, Thomas R. Gold, John Nicholson, and Moss Kent were were candidates for U.S. House of Representatives.
The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 17, uses the spelling McNiel for Henry McNeil.
The History of Chenango and Madison Counties uses the spelling Smally for Sylvanus Smalley, Foreman for Samuel S. Forman, and Myndert for Wilhelmus Mynderse.
The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), and the American Citizen (New York, NY) use the spelling Roswell for Roswell Hopkins.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 12, and the Otsego Herald use the name T.S. Foreman for Samuel S. Forman.

sub_unit.name: Allegany
sub_unit.note: Wilhelmus Mynderse received 16 votes as Wilhelmus Wilders.

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 17, reports 877 votes for Luther Rich, 1049 votes for Sylvanus Smalley, and 139 votes for John Sayre in Cayuga County.

sub_unit.name: Aurelius
sub_unit.note: John Sayre received 1 vote as John Sayer.
Wilhelmus Mynderse received 2 votes as W. Mynderse.
Francis A. Bloodgood received 4 votes as Francis Bloodgood.

sub_unit.name: Cato
sub_unit.note: Samuel S. Forman received 1 vote as Samuel Forman.

sub_unit.name: Dryden
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 2 votes as Francis Bloodgood.

sub_unit.name: Locke
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 1 vote as Francis Bloodgood.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: Wilhelmus Mynderse received 36 votes as Wilhelmus Myndert, 2 votes as W. Mynderse, and 1 vote as Wilhelmus F. Mynderse.

The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 17, The Olive-Branch (Norwich, NY), May 14, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 14, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 17, report 1188 for Francis A. Bloodgood, 1188 votes for Walter Martin, 362 votes for Samuel S. Forman, and 172 votes for Vincent Mathews in Chenango County.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 14, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), report 1165 votes for Luther Rich; however, the sum of totals per town is 1166.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 14, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), report 397 votes for Henry McNeil; however, the sum of totals per town is 400.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 14, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), report 362 votes for Samuel S. Forman; however, the sum of totals per town is 363.

The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 14, the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), and The Olive-Branch (Norwich, NY), May 14, report 197 votes for Wilhelmus Mynderse; however, the sum of totals per town is 196.
The Olive-Branch (Norwich, NY), May 14, reports 391 votes for Francis Henry; however, the sum of totals per town is 382.
The Olive-Branch (Norwich, NY), May 14, reports 362 votes for Samuel S. Forman; however, the sum of totals per town is 360.

"From the Oxford (Chenango) President of May 7. Votes listed for Congress Members, Senators and Assemblymen in the county of Chenango." American Citizen (New York, NY). May 14, 1808. Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY). May 17, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Columbus
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 14, and Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), report 64 votes for Henry McNeil in Columbus.

sub_unit.name: Coventry
sub_unit.note: The Olive-Branch (Norwich, NY), May 14, reports 26 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Coventry.

sub_unit.name: Sherburne
sub_unit.note: The Olive-Branch (Norwich, NY), April 30, reports 100 votes for Francis Henry in Sherburne.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: Walter Martin received 1 vote as William Martin
Leavet Fox received 1 vote as Leovit Fox.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, lists 43 votes for Samuel Forman and 127 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Genesee County. These have all been credited to Samuel S. Forman.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, reports 659 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood in Genesee County.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, reports 666 votes for Sylvanus Smalley in Genesee County; however, the sum of totals it lists per town is 664.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, reports 657 votes for Silas Halsey in Genesee County; however, the sum of totals it lists per town is 648.

sub_unit.name: Caledonia
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, lists 30 votes in Caledonia for Samuel Forman. These have been added to the total for Samuel S. Forman.

sub_unit.name: Leicester
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, lists 12 votes in Leicester for Samuel Forman. These have been added to the total for Samuel S. Forman.

sub_unit.name: Sheldon
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, lists 1 vote in Sheldon for Samuel Forman. This has been added to the total for Samuel S. Forman.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: Roswell Hopkins received 5 votes as Rossel Hopkinson.
Henry McNeil received 1 vote as Henry M. Neel.
Wilhelmus Mynderse received 1 vote as Wilhelmus My and 1 vote as Wilhelmus Myndul.
Francis Henry received 2 votes as Fraus Henry.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: Henry McNeil received 1 vote as Henry McKeil.
The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 17, reports 679 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood, 681 votes for Luther Rich, and 512 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Jefferson County.

sub_unit.name: Madison
sub_unit.note: Wilhelmus Mynderse received 5 votes as Wilhelmus Henderse and 4 votes as Wilhemus Mynderse.
Walter Martin received 1 vote as Wilter Martin.
Sylvanus Smalley received 1 vote as Sylenus Smalley, 1 vote as Sylvanus Salley and 1 vote as Sylumy Smalley.
Luther Rich received 3 votes as Lether Rich.
Francis A. Bloodgood received 2 votes as Francis A. Blood and 1 vote as Francis A. B. Bloodgood.
The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY) reports 1025 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood and 1032 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Madison County.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Luther Rich received 1 vote as Luther Rice.
Wilhelmus Mynderse received 3 votes as Wilhemus Mynderse and 1 vote as William Mynderse.
Francis A. Bloodgood received 1 vote as Franies A. Bloodgood.
Joshua Hatheway received 1 vote as Joshua Hathaway.

The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 10, the Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 10, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21, report 1605 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood, 1618 votes for Walter Martin, and 1976 votes for Wilhelmus Mynderse.

sub_unit.name: Boonville
sub_unit.note: Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), May 10, reports 55 votes for Wilhelmus Mynderse in Boonville.

sub_unit.name: Florence
sub_unit.note: Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), May 10, reports 20 votes for Samuel S. Forman and 18 votes for Wilhelmus Mynderse in Florence.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), May 10, reports 26 votes for Samuel S. Forman and 27 votes for Wilhelmus Mynderse in Orange.

sub_unit.name: Paris
sub_unit.note: Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), May 10, reports 154 votes for Luther Rich and 155 votes for Silas Halsey in Paris.

sub_unit.name: Richland
sub_unit.note: Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), May 10, reports 57 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood in Richland.

sub_unit.name: Rome
sub_unit.note: Utica Patriot (Utica, NY), May 10, reports 118 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood and 58 votes for Roswel Hopkins in Rome.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: Luther Rich received 4 votes as Luther Rice.
Walter Martin received 1 vote as Water Martin.
Putnam Catlin received 1 vote as Putnam Callin and 1 vote as Putnam Colton.
Wilhelmus Mynderse received 1 vote as Wilhemus Mynderse.
Francis A. Bloodgood received 1 vote as A. Francis Bloodgood.
Samuel S. Forman received 1 vote as Samuel J. Forman.

The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 3, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21, the Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 10 and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY) May 24, report 1382 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood, 1429 votes for Luther Rich, and 870 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Onondaga County.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: John Sayre received 52 votes as John Sayers.
Silas Halsey received 7 votes as Silas Hawley.
Sylvanus Smalley received 2 votes as Sylvanus Small.
Luther Rich received 4 votes as Luther Rice and 1 vote as Luther Richard.
Walter Martin received 1 vote as William Martin.
Francis A. Bloodgood received 23 votes as Francis Bloodgood.
Samuel S. Forman received 76 votes as Samuel Forman and 47 votes as Samuel F. Forman.
The single vote for Richard Bloodgood in Ontario County was not reported in the Official State Wide Canvass.

The Genesee Messenger (Canandaigua, NY), May 10, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 24, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 27, list town-by-town results for the Republican ticket, but only list county totals for the Federalist candidates.

The Genesee Messenger (Canandaigua, NY), May 10, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 24, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 27, report 1346 votes for Francis Henry and 1313 votes for Samuel S. Forman.

The Ontario Repository (Canandaigua, NY), May 10, also reports 1346 votes for Francis Henry and 1313 votes for Samuel S. Forman. However, the sum of totals per town, as it reports them (as opposed to the votes according to the original election certificates and consideration for misspellings) is 1344 and 1303, respectively.

sub_unit.name: Bloomfield
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 4 votes as Francis Bloodgood.
Samuel S. Forman received 1 vote as Samuel Forman.
Francis S. Forman received 1 vote as Francis F. Forman.
The Ontario Repository (Canandaigua, NY) reports 256 votes for Francis Henry and 256 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Bloomfield.

sub_unit.name: Farmington
sub_unit.note: Ninety-one votes for John Sayre in Farmington were not reported in the Official State Wide Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Hartford
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 8 votes as Francis Bloodgood.
Sylvanus Smalley received 2 votes as Sylvanus Small.

sub_unit.name: Phelps
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 2 votes as Francis Bloodgood.
Luther Rich received 4 votes as Luther Rice.

sub_unit.name: Seneca
sub_unit.note: Silas Halsey received 1 vote as Silas Hawley.

sub_unit.name: Sodus
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 5 votes as Francis Bloodgood.

sub_unit.name: Vernon
sub_unit.note: Samuel S. Forman received 2 votes as Samuel Forman.
Francis A. Bloodgood received 4 votes as Francis Bloodgood.
Silas Halsey received 6 votes as Silas Hawley.
The Ontario Repository (Canandaigua, NY) does not report any votes for Samuel S. Forman in Vernon.

sub_unit.name: Williamson
sub_unit.note: One vote for Richard Bloodgood in Williamson was not reported in the Official State Wide Canvass.
Walter Martin received 1 vote as William Martin.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 3 votes as Francis D. Bloodgood.
Wilhelmus Mynderse received 1 vote as William Mynderse and 1 vote as Wilhelmus Henderse.

The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21, omits returns from Worcester from its Otsego County listings, however, it reports the same totals as the Otsego Herald, May 14 does, which includes Worcester in the calculation.
The Otsego Herald (Cooperstown, NY) reports 1368 votes for Sylvanus Smalley in Otsego County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1364.

The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21, and the Otsego Herald (Cooperstown, NY) report 1350 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood, 1365 votes for Walter Martin, and 1157 votes for Samuel S. Forman in Otsego County.

sub_unit.name: Plainfield
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) reports 54 votes for Luther Rich in Plainfield.

sub_unit.name: Richfield
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) reports 89 votes for Francis A. Bloodgood in Richfield.

sub_unit.name: Saint Lawrence
sub_unit.note: Sylvanus Smalley received 1 vote as Sivanus Smally.

sub_unit.name: Schoharie
sub_unit.note: Wilhelmus Mynderse received 3 votes as William Mynderse.
Roswel Hopkins received 1 vote as Roswell.

sub_unit.name: Seneca
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 17, reports 449 votes for Sylvanus Smalley in Seneca County.
The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY), May 17, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 7, report 180 votes for Wilhelmus Mynderse in Seneca County.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 7, reports 2 votes for Daniel C. Buell in Seneca County.

sub_unit.name: Junius
sub_unit.note: Samuel S. Forman received 1 vote as Samuel Forman.

sub_unit.name: Ovid
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 1 vote as Francis Bloodgood.

sub_unit.name: Ulysses
sub_unit.note: Francis A. Bloodgood received 1 vote as Francis Bloodgood.

sub_unit.name: Steuben
sub_unit.note: On April 6, 1808, the name of Middletown, in Steuben County, was changed to Addison and the name of Fredericktown was changed to Wayne.

sub_unit.name: Tioga
sub_unit.note: Samuel S. Forman received 11 votes as Samuel S. Fairman.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
Clayton, W. W. History of Steuben County. Philadelphia: Lewis, Peck, and, 1879. 377.
Smith, James H. History of Chenango and Madison Counties New York. Syracuse, NY: D. Mason and, 1880. 389.
